fields.title: Top 5 Backend Frameworks in 2023
fields.description:
A software framework serves as a base for developers to develop applications quickly and effectively. According to Wikipedia, a framework's primary goal is to automate the overhead associated with software development operations. Today, backend frameworks are fundamental for the development of applications for a vast array of enterprises throughout the globe.

 

 For developers, selecting the ideal backend framework can be essential for achieving the best performance and scalability. Choosing from the various alternatives available nowadays might be difficult. The following are the main benefits of adopting a framework for development:


Less Time Needed
Reliability
Validity
Security
Incorporation


Additionally, the majority of frameworks are open-source. Now let's have a look at the top backend frameworks in 2023-


Django


A well-known open-source backend framework built on the Python programming language is Django. One of the simplest backend frameworks, Django is appropriate for the development of complex and feature-rich database-driven websites. One of the most fantastic backend web development frameworks is Django.


The back-end framework allows for better pluggability, less code, more reuse, and quicker development. All Django activities are performed in Python, and an optional admin interface is provided to assist with operations like creation, reading, updating, and deletion. Many well-known websites, including Disqus, Mozilla, and The Washington Times, use Django.


Benefits of Django 


Rapid Framework: Django is a framework with a minimal learning curve that was designed to make it easier for developers to accelerate the whole development cycle. For websites, it is regarded as an easy backend.


Flourishing Features: Django offers a wide range of functionality to assist users in handling some typical web development needs. It helps with several tasks, including user authentication, sitemaps, content management, and more.

 

Superlative Security: Django is a safe framework that aids users in avoiding a number of security problems, such as request forgery, cross-site scripting, clickjacking, and SQL injection. Users are given a system for user authentication so they may safely save and manage their passwords and accounts.


Multipurpose Framework: The framework Django may be used to create a variety of different applications kinds. Social networking tools, content management systems, and computing platforms are a few of them. 
 

ExpressJS


ExpressJS also referred to as Express, is an open-source web application framework of Node.js that is distributed under the MIT license. It is regarded as a basic Node.js server framework and is used for creating APIs and online applications. One of the top web application development frameworks is Express.


Benefits of ExpressJS


Simple Learning: Among the most popular programming languages, JavaScript is utilized by the majority of front-end developers. The Node.js backend is simple for developers to use because understanding it doesn't take much time or effort.


Single Programming Language: JavaScript can be used by developers to create server-side apps when using Node.js. Employing a JavaScript runtime environment it allows Node.js developers to construct both back-end and front-end web apps. There is no need for developers to use any additional server-side languages. The majority of widely-used browsers now support JavaScript, making the development of web applications simpler.


Elevated Performance: The V8 JavaScript engine from Google is used by Node.js to understand Node.js code. The engine supports the conversion of JavaScript-based code to machine code and makes it simpler to successfully execute the code. Due to JavaScript's capabilities for non-blocking I/O, the runtime environment further enhances execution speed.


Take Advantage of Full Stack JS Features: Node.js is a full-stack JavaScript backend that can be used for both server-side and client-side applications. Therefore, it is unnecessary to rely on separate front-end and back-end developers. It is a fantastic method to save both time and money.


Laravel 


Laravel is a PHP web framework that is also open source. Laravel is used For creating Symfony-based web applications that adhere to the model-view-controller (MVC) architecture. It provides specialized dependency management and a modular packaging mechanism.

 

One of the top web frameworks is Laravel, which some experts believe to be the greatest backend development tool. Along with offering its customers several methods of accessing relational databases, Laravel also offers application management and development tools. Laravel's source code is hosted on GitHub and is available under an MIT license.


Benefits of Laravel 


Easy Authentication: Laravel's basic configuration options make it easy to implement authentication. Simple structuring of authorization logic and straightforward resource access management is made possible by Laravel. 


Easy API: A straightforward API is provided by Laravel and is compatible with the SwiftMailer library. Mandrill, SMTP, Mailgun, Amazon SES, and SparkPost drivers are available from Laravel. Additionally, it sends mail and has PHP mail drivers. Via a local or cloud-based service, Laravel provides quick application mail sending. Additionally, it offers assistance with delivering notifications over several delivery methods.


Test Friendly: With support for PHPUnit and a ready-to-use phpunit.xml file for apps, Laravel is test-friendly. The framework includes helpful techniques for testing expressive applications. Additionally, Laravel offers simple user behavior modeling for tasks like form completion, link clicks, and app requests. 


Accumulated Backends: Support for Redis, Memcached, and other popular cache backends is conveniently available from Laravel. It makes use of the file cache driver to carry out caching of objects in a file system. An in-memory cache like APC or Memcached is used by bigger programs. Additionally, users of Laravel can set up several cache configurations.

 

Ruby on Rails 


MIT-licensed Ruby on Rails usually referred to as Rails, is a framework for server-side web applications. Rails is an MVC framework that provides web pages, web services, and database default structures. One of the greatest web development frameworks is Ruby on Rails, which some programmers believe to be the best web framework for performance.

 

For data transfers and user interface, Ruby on Rails encourages the usage of web standards like XML or JSON as well as CSS, JavaScript, and HTML. Software engineering patterns like the active record pattern, convention over configuration (CoC), and don't repeat yourself(DRY) are prioritized by Rails.


Benefits of Ruby on Rails 


Saves Time: Numerous pre-made modules and plugins are available in Ruby on Rails, allowing developers to spend less time writing boilerplate code. Compared to situations when they use other frameworks, it helps development teams to reduce application build times. 


Cost Efficient: Ruby on Rails is available as open-source software with an MIT license. It implies that there is no cost for consumers to get the framework. Users can add features by using Gems rather than building them from the bottom up. They can therefore save a great deal of time and work. The open-source website GitHub offers gems that may be downloaded for a variety of uses.


Efficient Development: Users may create software that is bug-free thanks to Ruby on Rails. Users may access several testing tools, including mocking, expectation syntax, and test benchmarking, using the Rails core's Minitest tool. The best platform for behavior-driven deployment (BDD) and test-driven deployment(TDD) is Ruby on Rails. These two development strategies are beneficial for lowering development expenses.


Consistency: Ruby on Rails gives programmers access to standardized file storage methods and coding guidelines. In addition to saving a lot of time, it helps in maintaining a project's structural uniformity and readability.


Cake PHP


A popular open-source web framework is CakePHP. It corresponds to the MVC architecture and was created in PHP. It is built on the ideas of Ruby on Rails and is accessible under an MIT license. Popular software engineering and design principles, such as convention over configuration, active record, front controller, model-view-controller, and data mapping, are used by CakePHP.


Benefits of Cake PHP


Object Relational Mapping: Object Relational Mapping, also known as ORM, is a method of converting data for incompatible systems. The feature-rich integrated ORM in CakePHP makes it simple for users to carry out CRUD and database operations. For the purpose of defining relations, data is generally available as classes. The backend can be used by CakePHP users to predefine callbacks. 


Capable of Being Extended: Users may construct reusable code components for usage in many projects using the CakePHP backend. Many functions, including aids, components, behaviors, and plug-ins, can be used by users without expanding libraries. The website for the backend contains a ton of plug-ins and tools for developers' efficiency.


Create, Read, Update, and Delete Functionality: Users may create, read, update, and delete operations within an application using CakePHP's CRUD capability. Entities are simple for developers to create, examine, read, edit, and remove. This facilitates application demoing and enables them to easily modify models and controllers for particular reasons. Throughout the web development process, data management also gets simpler. Users find this useful since only one line of code is needed to create a basic application view.

 

The information shown here might assist you in selecting among the top 5 backend frameworks currently on the market. The most popular backend frameworks addressed in the article are Django, Laravel, Ruby on Rails, etc. Laravel is the most popular backend framework, according to Statistics and data. Django is only slightly behind in the race for second.

fields.title: The Ultimate Checklist We Follow for Ensuring Mobile App Security and Data Protection
fields.description:
Mobile applications have become an integral part of our daily lives, and with their increasing popularity, comes the need for robust security measures to protect the sensitive data they handle. Mobile app security and data protection are essential to ensure that user information, such as personal and financial data, is safeguarded from cyber threats.

 

Developers must be attentive to ensure that their applications are secure and adhere to industry standards for data protection. This involves following a comprehensive checklist to identify potential vulnerabilities and implement measures to mitigate them. The checklist covers various aspects of security, such as secure coding practices, encryption, authentication, and data storage, among others.

 

In this age of digitalization, app users demand secure and trustworthy mobile applications, and developers must prioritize security in their development process to meet these expectations. By following a comprehensive security checklist, mobile app developers can ensure that their applications are secure, reliable, and trustworthy for their users. Now let's look at the checklist we follow to ensure mobile app security and data protection-


Encrypting Data Across Applications To Make It Unreadble For Hackers


With the increasing use of mobile applications, the need to secure sensitive data from hackers has become crucial. Encryption is one of the most effective methods to safeguard data from unauthorized access. Encrypting data across mobile applications, becomes unreadable for hackers, even if they manage to gain access to it. 

 

This is because the data is converted into a code that can only be deciphered with the proper encryption key. Properly encrypted data ensures that even if a hacker intercepts the data, they cannot make sense of it without the decryption key. As a result, encryption is essential for protecting sensitive information such as passwords, financial data, and personal information from theft and unauthorized access.


Ensure Bug-Free And Secure Source Codes


When it comes to developing a mobile app, ensuring that the source code is bug-free and secure is of utmost importance. A single vulnerability or loophole in the code can potentially compromise the entire app's security, putting users' sensitive data at risk. Therefore, developers must prioritize implementing robust security measures from the outset of the development process.

 

To ensure bug-free and secure source code, developers can follow several best practices. These include using secure coding practices, conducting regular code reviews, implementing encryption and authentication protocols, and performing thorough testing and debugging. By taking these steps, developers can reduce the likelihood of bugs and vulnerabilities in the code, as well as detect and address any issues that do arise.

 

Furthermore, it's important to note that security is an ongoing process that requires continuous monitoring and updates to address new threats and vulnerabilities. Thus, developers should remain vigilant in keeping their code up to date and implementing the latest security measures to ensure the ongoing protection of users' data. By prioritizing security throughout the development process and beyond, developers can help ensure that their mobile apps are safe and secure for users to use.


Integrate User Authentications To Validate The Identity


Integrating user authentication is a crucial step toward ensuring mobile app security. With the increasing number of cyber attacks, it's important to have a mechanism in place that verifies the identity of users accessing the app. This can be achieved through various authentication methods such as passwords, biometrics, two-factor authentication, and multi-factor authentication.

 

By implementing user authentication, mobile app developers can prevent unauthorized access, safeguard sensitive data, and protect users' privacy. Additionally, it enables the app to comply with various security standards and regulations. Integrating user authentication also improves the user experience, as users can be confident that their data is secure, and that they are interacting with a legitimate app.


Submitting Apps To Stores For Ensuring Consents And Integrity


One of the essential steps in securing a mobile app is submitting it to app stores such as Google Play and Apple's App Store, which have strict guidelines and security measures in place to ensure app consent and integrity. These app stores review and test the app thoroughly to ensure that it meets its standards and does not pose any security risks to users. By submitting mobile apps to app stores, developers can ensure that their apps are secure and can be trusted by users.


Integrate Security Alert For Code Tampering


To ensure that an app is secure, it is important to integrate a security alert for code tampering. This alert should be designed to detect any changes made to the app's code, including attempts to modify or replace it. This will help developers identify any potential security breaches and take action to prevent them from occurring.

 

The security alert for code tampering can be implemented using a variety of techniques, including code obfuscation and encryption. Developers can also use app protection tools that offer a range of security features, including code obfuscation, anti-tampering, and anti-reverse engineering.

 

By implementing this alert, developers can ensure that their apps are secure and protected from malicious attacks, providing users with peace of mind and confidence in the app's security.

Perform Necessary Security Tests


Security testing is a crucial aspect of ensuring the safety of mobile apps and data. It involves a series of procedures to identify vulnerabilities and threats that may compromise the security of an application. The tests aim to determine the effectiveness of the security measures implemented in the app and to identify areas for improvement.

 

The tests may include penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, authentication and authorization testing, data encryption testing, and compliance testing. By performing security tests, mobile app developers and owners can ensure that their apps and data are safe from cyberattacks, data breaches, and other security risks. It also helps to build trust among users and increase the credibility of the app.


Backend Security Is Also Crucial


Mobile app security is not just about protecting the front or user-facing aspects of the app. Backend security is equally important for ensuring the safety and privacy of user data. The backend includes servers, databases, APIs, and other infrastructure components that power the app's functionality.

 

Any vulnerability in the backend can be exploited by hackers to gain unauthorized access to sensitive data or disrupt the app's operations. To prevent such attacks, developers must implement robust security measures, such as encryption, access controls, and regular security audits, to protect the backend infrastructure. Neglecting backend security can result in severe consequences, including data breaches, financial loss, and damage to the app's reputation.


Conclusion


In conclusion, mobile app security and data protection should be a top priority for any organization developing or using mobile applications. By following the ultimate checklist outlined in this article, companies can ensure that their apps are secure, user data is protected, and they comply with relevant regulations. It's essential to stay vigilant and proactive in implementing security measures to safeguard against cyber threats.

Mobile app security and data protection are essential to ensure that user information, such as personal and financial data, is safeguarded from cyber threats.

fields.title: What is bespoke software development?
fields.description:
What is bespoke software?

 

Bespoke Software is a custom made software that’s developed based on customer’s needs and requirements. Off the shelf software is a software which is already developed serving general purpose. Bespoke Software is the opposite of Off the Shelf software. 

 

For example, at Qtec Solution Limited, a software development company we have a ready made software named ‘Creaify’ which is OpenAI’s chatGPT integrated with unlimited prompt creation feature and anyone can buy it in no time. On the other hand, the company has a full pledge team for providing bespoke software development service. 

 

The term is not new. People also identify it as custom software.

 

 

What is bespoke software development? 

 

It’s a process where you typically hire a company that takes the full responsibility of developing the custom software. Developing a software has multiple processes like analyzing and preparing Software Specific Requirements (SRS).

 

Then, doing UI/UX design based on the SRS. Frontend development, backend development comes after that.  Then of course the deployment stages. Throughout the whole process, as a client the software development company keeps you highly involved in an agile way. Your involvement makes it custom tailored software with feedback in loop.

 

 

Why choose Bespoke software instead of Off The Shelf? 

 

Well, this mostly depends on your requirements and budget. For example you want to create a Learning Management System where students can come to learn about coding. If you Google search you will find tons of LMS scripts from 100 US dollar to 500 US Dollars. If any of those matches your requirements you might go for it. 

 

But, if you want to create something special and give an experience that no other LMS is giving, you will have to go for custom tailored software development. Those scripts are generally purposely made while you might need a customly designed one.

 

 

Why does a business develop bespoke software?

 

There are a lot of reasons to develop custom software. Businesses develop custom software to avoid following reasons:

 

  1. Not highly scalable: In general purpose Off The Shelf software is not highly scalable a lot of the time. When your users, visitors increase in a significant level, it might not work well as it is not tested and developed for large scale usage. 

 

  1. Unwanted codebase: As the software is developed for common industry users, it must have a lot of features, codebase that you don’t need. The APIs are being called, the functions are being called, the heavy codebase affects the performance of the software. Also, it is responsible for high server bills. 

 

  1. Your software is the same as your competitors: As the system used by a lot of businesses like yours, all of your software looks the same, acts the same. This doesn't create your unique brand identification. Also, if any issue is found in the codebase, all the same sites are vulnerable to the hackers at the same time.

 

  1. Your product is not unique: There’s no innovation or creativity in your product, as it came out of one team’s brainstorming. Your user might search and find the alternative software which is the same as your own. 

 

  1. You might not have full control: Some of the time, Off the Shelf software developers don't give full control to the clients. A software might need a lot of third party packages, libraries, assets, APIs with licences that you might not own.

 

  1. You don’t have a say: In Off the Shelf software, you don’t have a say for the product. You will have to take whatever they have if there’s no customization option. 

 

Apart from those, there are more reasons why companies develop custom tailored software. These are also the disadvantages of Off The Shelf Software solutions. 

 

 

 

Advantages of Bespoke Software Development

 

  1. Your innovation solves the problem:  when you plan to develop a software, that’s because you identified a problem that you would like to solve with a tech product. You bring your USP, innovation, creativity into it. The biggest advantage of bespoke software is, you have full freedom to do it.

 

  1. Scalability: In custom development, you can make it as scalable as possible. If you know your target audience(TG), the size of the market and your plan of acquisition, you can develop a scalable software based on that. This way, it will save a lot of time and money later.

 

  1. Designed according to your business: A Off the shelf software is designed according to the vast industry while a bespoke software is designed for specially your business. 

 

  1. Intellectual property ownership: With custom development, you and your business owns the codebase, assets and full intellectual property. At Qtec Solution Limited, we hand over all the intellectual property once the project is completed. The client is the sole owner on the IP. 

 

  1. No unwanted API/Gateway/Function in code: There’s no unwanted API/Gateway/Function/Class is integrated or written without your consent and without the requirements. That keeps the project extremely clean, readable, usable and fast. Writing unwanted class functions codes might hamper the overall performance and affect the end user.

 

  1. Aligns with Vision: A bespoke software aligns with a long term vision. It can be made aligning with your future plan, quality of support and many more.

 

 

 

Disadvantages of Custom Software Development

 

However along with a wide range of advantages there might be some drawbacks to bespoke software development. Here are a few,

 

  1. Cost: As Off the shelf software is sold to a lot of same industry customers, the company can keep a very low cost and you can afford it very easily. While, custom tailored software development might seem costly in comparison to this.

 

  1. Time: You need to invest a fair amount of time while developing bespoke software. For Off the shelf software it’s like plug and play. You just buy it and use it within a week or just a day.

 

  1. Long Process: A bespoke software development can take months to be developed. It’s a long process if your project is not your fulltime concern but a side hustle. 

 

 

How to choose a Bespoke software development company?

 

There are a lot of companies around the world that provide custom tailored software development services. You need to be careful while selecting a company to do your job.

 

  1. Check if the company understands the project: It’s important to have a good understanding of the project. If they understand the technical requirements as well as business requirements, you are good to move forward. 

 

  1. Agile software development method: There are a lot of software development methodologies. Check if the agency follows any agile software development method like scrum. This will keep you in loop.

 

  1. If the team is full time: A bespoke software development is a big job. A lot of the time companies tend to develop it with part timers which have a lot of potential to fail. Check if the agency has software engineers in house. We, Qtec Solution Limited, identified this problem long ago and all of our team members are in house.

 

  1. Team capacity: To develop a bespoke software a company requires multiple team expertise like, Business team to analyse requirements, UI/UX Design team to convert the requirements into Figma design. Then the frontend and backend software engineers come in. After that a good Software Quality Assurance is needed to test and make the software bug free.

 

 

 

Looking to consult your idea and get a free estimation? At Qtec Solution Limited, we do that for free. You are one step away. Click the contact us link and book a meeting at calendly.

Note: You will be assigned a task in reply to your application. On your successful completion, you’ll be shortlisted for an interview.

Software Engineer (Django Developer)

fields.description: They have done four of our projects and we have got just what we wanted! We are going to work with them for a very long period of time, I can assure.

fields.name: Azhar Islam
fields.description: I cannot recommend QTEC enough. The team are excellent, they really do understand development very well. I also love that the whole team are proficient in English, this really helps with coordinating project meetings with my clients from UK. I believe QTEC will have a good future of growth as it has spearheaded leadership from Mosarrof Hossain, a pioneer in my opinion for software services in Bangladesh. Lastly, I look forward to working with QTEC for the foreseeable future, I wish them all the best in other areas also.
